sen.j: 藤原南家（ふじわらなんけ）とは、右大臣藤原不比等の長男藤原武智麻呂を祖とする家系。
sen.e: Fujiwara Nanke is a family line whose originator is FUJIWARA no Muchimaro who is the eldest son of minister of the right, FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
Fujiwara Nanke was a family line whose originator was FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Fuhito, the minister of the right.
The Southern House of the Fujiwara clan was a family line whose originator was FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Fuhito, the minister of the right.

sen.j: 藤原武智麻呂の邸宅が弟の藤原房前の邸宅よりも南に位置したことがこの名の由来。
sen.e: The name comes from the fact that the house of FUJIWARA no Muchimaro was located south of the house of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.

sen.j: 祖の武智麻呂は藤原北家の藤原房前とともに、元正天皇朝～聖武天皇朝にかけて長屋王と政権を争ったが、神亀6年（729年）長屋王の変により政権を掌握し、藤原四兄弟たちと共に聖武朝で政権を主導した（藤原四子政権）が、天平9年（737年）の天然痘蔓延により他の兄弟とともに病没してしまう。
sen.e: The originator Muchimaro fought with FUJIWARA no Fusasaki of Fujiwara Hokke (Fujiwara Hoku Family) against Nagayao for political power from the Gensho Emperor's era through the Shomu Emperor's era, and gained the political power after Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) in 729, and led the political power in the Shomu Emperor's era with Fujiwara four brothers (the political power by Fujiwara four children), but died together with other brothers in 737 due to the spread of smallpox.

Thereafter, in the period of Emperor Kanmu, FUJIWARA no Tsugutada, the son of Toyonari who was Muchimaro's eldest son, and FUJIWARA no Korekimi, the son of FUJIWARA no Otomaro who was Muchimaro's third son, successively became minister of the right, whereby the power of Nanke was maintained.

Thereafter, in the period of the Emperor Kanmu, FUJIWARA no Tsugutada, the son of Toyonari who was Muchimaro's eldest son, and FUJIWARA no Korekimi, the son of FUJIWARA no Otomaro who was Muchimaro's third son, successively became minister of the right, whereby the power of Nanke was maintained.Thereafter, in the period of the Emperor Kanmu, FUJIWARA no Tsugutada, the son of Toyonari who was Muchimaro's eldest son, and FUJIWARA no Korekimi, the son of FUJIWARA no Otomaro who was Muchimaro's third son, successively became minister of the right, whereby the power of the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan was maintained.
sen.cmt: "the" を挿入しました。"Nanke" -> "the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan" に変更しました。

sen.j: 武智麻呂には4人の息子があり、孝謙天皇朝～称徳天皇朝にかけて、長男藤原豊成（右大臣）・次男藤原仲麻呂（太政大臣）が続いて大臣となった。
sen.e: Muchimaro had four sons, and from the Koken Emperor's era through Shotoku Emperor's era the first son, FUJIWARA no Toyonari (minister of the right) and the second son, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (grand minister of state) successively became minister.

Muchimaro had four sons, and from the era of Emperor Koken through that of Emperor Shotoku the first son, FUJIWARA no Toyonari (the minister of the right) and the second son, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (the grand minister of state), successively became ministers.

Muchimaro had four sons, and from the era of Emperor Koken through that of Emperor Shotoku the first son, FUJIWARA no Toyonari (the minister of the right) and the second son, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (the grand minister of state), successively became ministers.

sen.j: 特に仲麻呂は淳仁天皇を擁立すると、息子3人（藤原真先・藤原訓儒麻呂・藤原朝狩）を参議とし前代未聞の親子4人を公卿とするなど権力を独占したが、天平宝字8年（764年）藤原仲麻呂の乱により失脚した。
sen.e: In particular, Nakamaro backed Junnin Emperor and made his three sons (FUJIWARA no Masaki, FUJIWARA no Kusumaro, and FUJIWARA no Asakari) Sangi (a state of council), whereby four people of Nakamaro and his sons became noble to dominate power, but fell from power as a result of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War in 764.

Nakamaro, in particular, backed Emperor Junnin and made his three sons (FUJIWARA no Masaki, FUJIWARA no Kusumaro and FUJIWARA no Asakari) sangi (councilors of state), whereby four people of Nakamaro and his sons became nobles and seized the dominant power; however, they fell from power as a result of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's war in 764.

Nakamaro, in particular, backed Emperor Junnin and made his three sons (FUJIWARA no Masaki, FUJIWARA no Kusumaro and FUJIWARA no Asakari) sangi (councilors of state), whereby four people of Nakamaro and his sons became nobles and seized the dominant power; however, they fell from power as a result of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's war in 764.

sen.j: その後も桓武天皇朝において、武智麻呂の長男豊成の子藤原継縄と、三男藤原乙麻呂の子藤原是公が続いて右大臣となり、南家は勢力を維持した。
sen.e: Thereafter, in the Kanmu Emperor's period, FUJIWARA no Tsugutada, son of Toyonari who is Muchimaro's eldest son, and FUJIWARA no Korekimi, son of FUJIWARA no Otomaro who is Muchimaro's third son, successively became minister of the right, whereby the power of Nanke was maintained.

Thereafter, in the era of Emperor Kanmu, FUJIWARA no Tsugutada, the son of Toyonari (Muchimaro's eldest son), and FUJIWARA no Korekimi, son of FUJIWARA no Otomaro (Muchimaro's third son) successively became the minister of the right, whereby the power of Nanke was maintained.

Thereafter, in the era of Emperor Kammu, FUJIWARA no Tsugutada, the son of Toyonari (Muchimaro's eldest son), and FUJIWARA no Korekimi, the son of FUJIWARA no Otomaro (Muchimaro's third son) successively became the minister of the right, whereby the power of the Southern House was maintained.
sen.cmt: Kanmu→Kammu 他ファイルと統一、ヘボン式"Nanke" -> "the Southern House" に変更しました。

sen.j: しかしながら、続く平城天皇朝の大同2年（807年）に当時政権№2,3の座にあった、藤原雄友（是公の子：大納言）・藤原乙叡（継縄の子：中納言）が伊予親王の変により失脚し、仲麻呂に続き、豊成・乙麻呂の系統も中央貴族としては衰退した。
sen.e: However, in 807 that is in the next Heijo Emperor's era, FUJIWARA no Otomo (son of Korekimi: chief councillor of state) and FUJIWARA no otoei/Tadatoshi (son of Tsugutada: vice councilor of state), who were in the second and third position of the political power at that time, fell from power as a result of Iyo Shinno no Hen (Conspiracy of Iyo Imperial Prince), whereby the family lines of Toyonari and Otomaro declined as the central nobility followed by the fall of Nakamaro.

However, in 807, during the era of Emperor Heijo, FUJIWARA no Otomo (son of the korekimi, or chief councilor of state) and FUJIWARA no otoei/Tadatoshi (son of the tsugutada the vice councilor of state), who were in the second and third position of the political power at that time, fell from power as a result of Iyo Shinno no Hen (the Conspiracy of Imperial Prince Iyo), whereby the family lines of Toyonari and Otomaro declined as the central nobility, followed by the fall of Nakamaro.

However, in 807, during the era of Emperor Heijo, FUJIWARA no Otomo (son of the Korekimi, or Dainagon (chief councilor of state)) and FUJIWARA no otoei/Tadatoshi (son of the Tsugutada, or Chunagon (vice-councilor of state)), who were in the second and third positions of the political power at the time, fell from power as a result of Iyo Shinno no Hen (the Conspiracy of Imperial Prince Iyo), whereby the family lines of Toyonari and Otomaro declined as the central nobility, followed by the fall of Nakamaro.

sen.j: なお、乙麻呂の系統で平安中期に武人として頭角を顕した藤原為憲の子孫は各地に広がり、伊東氏、工藤氏、二階堂氏、相良氏、吉川氏、天野氏といった各氏の祖となった。

sen.j: 平安時代中期以後は、藤原北家に押され政治的に衰退する中、武智麻呂の四男藤原巨勢麻呂の子孫が中央貴族として続き、多くの学者を輩出した。
sen.e: After the Middle Heian era, in the midst of political decline of Fujiwara Nanke due to the expanding power of Fujiwara Hokke, the descendant of FUJIWARA no Kosemaro who is the fourth son of Muchimaro survived as the central nobility and many of the descendant became scholars.

After the mid-Heian era, amid the political decline of the Southern House due to the expanding power of the Northern House, the descendant of FUJIWARA no Kosemaro, who was the fourth son of Muchimaro, survived as the central nobility and many of the descendants became scholars.
